articles.author: Erich Fitzgerald, Ruairidh Duncan
articles.title: A cornucopia of tiny, bizarre whales used to live in Australian waters – here’s one of them - The Conversation
articles.description: If alive today, these tiny whales would be as iconically Australian as kangaroos.
articles.content:
Australia is home to a unique bunch of native land mammals, such as koalas, wombats and wallabies. These furballs evolved in isolation on this island continent and have become Australian symbols.
